item.title: Example Page 1

item.title: SBOL
Genetic Circuit Dynamics: Hazard and Glitch Analysis
Toward Reproducible Disease Models Using the Systems Biology Markup Language
A Computational Workflow for the Automated Generation of Models of Genetic Designs
iBioSim 3: A Tool for Model-Based Genetic Circuit Design
Specifications of Standards in Systems and Synthetic Biology: Status and Developments in 2017
SynBioHub: A Standards-Enabled Design Repository for Synthetic Biology
Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) Version 2.2.0
Synthetic Biology Open Language Visual (SBOL Visual) Version 2.0
A Validator and Converter for the Synthetic Biology Open Language
SBOLDesigner 2: An Intuitive Tool for Structural Genetic Design
A Standard-Enabled Workflow for Synthetic Biology
SBOLme: A Repository of SBOL Parts for Metabolic Engineering
Specifications of Standards in Systems and Synthetic Biology: Status and Developments in 2016
Synthetic Biology Open Language (SBOL) Version 2.1.0
Design of Mixed-Signal Systems With Asynchronous Control
Guest Editors' Introduction Challenges and Opportunities in Analog/Mixed-Signal CAD
Toward Community Standards and Software for Whole-Cell Modeling
Efficient Analysis of Systems Biology Markup Language Models of Cellular Populations Using Arrays
A Converter from the Systems Biology Markup Language to the Synthetic Biology Open Language
Sharing Structure and Function in Biological Design with SBOL 2.0
An Improved Fault-Tolerant Routing Algorithm for a Network-on-Chip Derived with Formal Analysis
libSBOLj 2.0: A Java Library to Support SBOL 2.0

item.description:
Professor

Professor Myers

Graduate Students

Pedro Fontanarrosa, Phd Candidate

Jet Mante, Phd Candidate

Lukas Buecherl, Phd Candidate

Logan Terry, MS

Undergraduate Students

James Scholz

Eric Yu

Ben Hatch

Alumni

Postdoctoral Fellows

  • Sung-Tae Jung, Professor, Wonkwang University, Korea.

  • Jian Wu, Toshiba America Electronic Components, Inc., San Jose, CA, USA

PhD Students

  • Nathan Barker, Southern Utah University, Cedar City, UT.
  • Wendy Belluomini, IBM Almaden, San Jose, CA.
  • Jie Dai, Director of IP Dept. in Brite Semiconductor (Shanghai) Corporation.
  • Andrew Fisher, Sandia National Laboratories, Albuquerque, NM.
  • Hans Jacobson, IBM Yorktown, NY.
  • Hiroyuki Kuwahara, KAUST, Thuwal, Saudi Arabia.
  • Scott Little, Mentor Graphics, Hillsboro, OR.
  • Curtis Madsen, Sandia National Laboratories, Albuquerque, NM.
  • Eric Mercer, Associate Professor, Brigham Young University, Provo, UT.
  • Curt Nelson, Professor, Walla Walla University, Walla Walla, WA.
  • Tramy Nguyen, BBN/Raytheon, Boston, MA.
  • Eric Peskin, Center for Health Informatics and Bioinformatics, New York, NY.
  • Nicholas Roehner, BBN/Raytheon, Boston, MA.
  • Robert Thacker, AMD Austin, TX.
  • David Walter, Capital One, Richmond, VA.
  • Leandro Watanabe, Google, Seattle, CA.
  • Zhen Zhang, Assistant Professor, Utah State University, Logan, UT.
  • Hao Zheng, Associate Professor, University of South Florida, Tampa, FL.

MS Students

  • Brandon Bachman, Intel Corporation, Folsom, CA.
  • Satish Batchu, Qualcomm, Raleigh, NC.
  • Kip Killpack, Intel Corporation, Hillsboro, OR.
  • Christopher Krieger, Intel Corporation, Fort Collins, CO.
  • Dhanashree Kulkarni, Intel Corporation, Hillsboro, OR.
  • Nam Nguyen, University of Illinois in Urbana-Champaign, IL.
  • Meher Samineni, REI, Seattle, CA.
  • Michael Zhang, Google, Sunnyvale, CA.
  • Yanyi Zhao, Stryker, San Jose, CA.

Undergraduate Students

  • Jeff Cuthbert, Raytheon, Dallas, TX.
  • Scott Glass, University of Utah, UT.
  • Kevin Jones, Aberdeen Proving Ground, Philadelphia, PA.
  • Tyler Patterson, DataStax, Salt Lake City, UT.
  • John Perry, JPMorgan, New York City, NY.
  • Nick Seegmiller, Backcountry.com, Park City, UT.
  • Allen Sjogren, Hart Scientific, Salt Lake City, UT.
  • Jason Stevens, Expeditors, Seattle, WA.
